title: Mount Rushmore National Memorial: Field Trips
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Education     Parks as Classrooms     Field Trips                Field Trips         Park ranger with students at Mount Rushmore. NPS Photo  Mount Rushmore National Memorial welcomes school groups throughout the year for self-guided visits that include the Lincoln Borglum Museum, Mount Rushmore - The Shrine movie and the half-mile Presidential Trail.  During our Field Trip Season, mid-April through early May, school groups may participate in a ranger led activity in the historic Sculptor's Studio. These ranger talks are available by reservation only and as availability permits. To help defray the cost of school bus parking at Presidential Parking, the Mount Rushmore History Association provides bus parking scholarships throughout the year, pending availability of funds. Applications must be received 2 weeks before the date requested. 2016 Education Newsletter (727 KB PDF) Download the 2016 Field Trip and Parking Scholarship application (80 KB PDF) Questions? Contact us...  Tips for filling out the Application Form:  Save the pdf form to your computer Fill it out electronically and save your work Attach the completed form to an email or Print and fax the completed form
